channel.title: Please someone help me!
channel.description: Ok I download servers and I cant play any of them they all say error connecting to server and at first I thought server must be offline but all my buddies are on that exact server playing so if someone could help me it would be very much appriceated and this is a new laptop so im thinking maybe I need to fix the paths or something with my firewall im not sure help would be nice It keeps saying this [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img185.imageshack.us/img185/8009/errorqj7.jpg[/img][/URL]

item.title: Please someone help me!
item.dc:creator: @deshawn82 deshawn82
item.description:
@deshawn82 wrote:

Neither of those worked any other suggestions [br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 07, 2008, 09:11:03 pm[/size][hr]could someone perhaps tell me in more depth how to do variables or point me to a good vista tut cause i tried what guy said abaove and it didnt work[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 09, 2008, 02:40:57 am[/size][hr]could a mod please lock this I got the problem fixed

Read full topic

item.title: Please someone help me!
item.dc:creator: @Jonesy1128 Jonesy1128
item.description:
@Jonesy1128 wrote:

Make sure you’ve downloaded Java also.

To set up paths in Vista; Start Menu -> right click “Computer” -> Properties -> Advanced System Settings -> Environmental Variables -> create a new variable with the values:

Variable: JAVA_HOME
Value: Drive:\Program Files\Java\Jreversion

Edit value to work for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Please someone help me!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

You perhaps should set Java to your CLASSPATH?

I am not too sure how to do it in Vista, but this is how to do it in Windows XP:

1. Right-click on your 'My Computer' icon, and select 'Properties'. 2. Once in there, choose the tab 'Advanced' and click on the button 'Environmental Variables'. 3. In the second box of information you see, select the one called 'Path', and click on 'Edit'. 4. At the end of the text already written, append a semicolon ( ; ). 5. You should go to your Java folder (JRE) and copy the path for the bin folder in there. 6. Now, after the semicolon ( ; ), append the path you copied in #5, and save this.

Read full topic
